1.  Proof 0Ï Theorem 3
This depends on an interesting comparison theorem,  which we state as our third proposition. 
Proposition III.  Let D be a bounded domain in £ * * whose boundary is the union of two closed sets у and y\ with y' being of class C^.  Let и be a solution of the minimal surface equation in D which is continuous on у and continuously differentiable on y\ Also let v be a supersolution in D which is continuous in the closure of D and such that dvjdn = — 00 at ei>ery interior point of y\
Under these conditions^ if и ^v on y then и ^ v throughout D. 
Proof.  IÎ и ^v ony' the result follows from the maximum principle,  as in the proof of Proposition I.  Thus suppose for contradiction that
d — maXy / ( m — v ) > 0. 
Then by the maximum principle,  и ^v - ^ d thoughout D.  By the definition of d there is an interior point P on y' where и ^ ri - \ - d.  \vi combination with the previous inequality,  this yields

which contradicts the assumption that bvlbn = — 00 on 7'.
